title: Dixon Correctional Center - 2022 Emails containing "Memo" "yard" & "X House"

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Dixon Correctional Center - 2022 Emails containing "Memo" "yard" & "X House"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Dixon Correctional Center:  

Any emails between the staff and/or outside governmental departments containing the below words from 2022 until the day of this request:

"Memo" or "memos" 
"Yard" or "Outdoors" or "Outside"
"X House" or "X-House" or "Psychiatric Unit" or "Psychiatric wing"

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn

title: EEOC Complaints with Village of Niles as Respondent

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: EEOC Complaints with Village of Niles as Respondent
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All formal complaints filed between 1/1/2014 and the date this request is processed (inclusive of those dates) with the "Village of Niles" as a respondent.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Springfield IDOC phone & email directory
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Springfield Illinois Department of Corrections:  

Telephone directory of all current Springfield Illinois Department of Corrections employees and staff.

Email directory of all current Springfield Illinois Department of Corrections employees and staff.

Comprehensive list of current phone numbers, extensions, and corresponding names. If possible, please include position titles of each extension. For example, extension 6226 is Family Liaisons (position title) and directs the caller to Natalie Mason (name).

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn
